FacilityName: Fulton Market Cold Storage Company, LLC
SafetyInspectionBy: City of Chicago. Dept. of Buildings, Refrigeration
DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Under new Ownership - Site Remediated & being converted to Office/Retail

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
(a) The administrative, management and operations staff at Fulton Market take pride in being a part of the local community and understand that responsibility and commitment are integral components of the privilege of being a good neighbor.

To assure the preservation of this standing, the health and safety of the community, our employees and visitors, as well as the protection of the environment, are given first priority in all facets of our company operations.  

It is our policy to perform all necessary actions and maintenance on the system to prevent, as best as possible, a release from occurring.  It is also our policy to immediately report to the proper federal, state and municipal authorities any release of hazardous or extremely hazardous materials from the site so that a proper response may be mounted.  

(b) Our facility is a cold storage warehouse.  We only store edible food products and are regularly inspected by the USDA.  The stationary source is a refrigeration system.  The regulated substance is ammonia.  

(c) Fulton Market has implemented a Process Safety Management Program under OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119.  The objective of this program is to significantly reduce the possibility of an uncontrolled release of ammonia from the ammonia refrigeration system.  The elements of this program also correspond with all standards set forth in OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111 and EPA 40 CFR 38 Subpart D, and include consistent, proactive measures toward maintaining the integrity and safe operation of the system.  

(d) There have been no accidents, as defined by the regulations, within the previous five years.  

(e) We have an on-going program to perform all necessary actions and maintenance on the system to prevent, as best as possible, a release from occurring.  As part of our program we rely upon the proper federal, state and municipal authorities to assist in the response to any release of hazardous or extremely hazardous materials from the site.  

(f) The management conti

nuously reviews requests, and funds projects, to upgrade equipment as it is required to maintain a safely operating system.  

Through adherence to high safety standards, and open and ongoing dialogue with our employees and neighbors, we hope to maintain and enhance the good relationship that we?ve enjoyed for many years.
